abstract: Google is closing a loophole that allowed people to read large numbers of articles on subscription-based sites without paying for them.
snippet: Google is closing a loophole that allowed people to read large numbers of articles on subscription-based sites without paying for them.
lead_paragraph: Amid criticism from media companies that it unfairly profits from news content, Google is closing a loophole that allowed some motivated newshounds to read large numbers of articles on subscription-based sites without paying for them.

headline.main: Google Restricts Free Reading on Pay News Sites

abstract: The list of mutual friends that pops up when you visit someone’s Facebook page is underappreciated but immensely valuable in real-world interactions.
snippet: The list of mutual friends that pops up when you visit someone’s Facebook page is underappreciated but immensely valuable in real-world interactions.
lead_paragraph: 2009 has been a busy year for Facebook. The social networking service just reached a whopping 350 million users. It redesigned its site, then redesigned those redesigns (say that three times fast). And as Mark Zuckerberg, the site’s founder and chief executive, announced Tuesday, the company is getting ready to release a new set of privacy policies in the coming weeks.

headline.main: Facebook’s Killer Feature: The Mutual Friends List
